page.title: 05THE NEW HOSPITAL IN STAFFORD
page.content: The new Stafford and District General Hospital was officially opened on June 5th, 1984 by the Duchess of Kent. The building stands on the site of the 150 year old Coton Hill Hospital, about 2 miles from the centre of Stafford. When it opened,three smaller hospitals outside the town were closed, but the old Staffordshire General Infirmary is still in use, at least for the present. The new site is easy for patients and visitors to reach, and there is a very good bus service to the hospital. The hospital has 320 beds at the moment. There are five operating theatres, a most modern physiotherapy and X-Ray department, and of course a large well equipped Accident and Emergency area. The hospital cost 20 million pounds and is providing Staffordshire with the very best of medical and surgical care.
